Tagline: A groundbreaking collaboration blending experimental electronic textures with modular synthesis and ambient soundscapes.
Bio: Actress & Suzanne Ciani is a collaboration between British electronic producer Actress and American electronic music pioneer Suzanne Ciani, blending experimental electronic textures with modular synthesis and ambient soundscapes.
AI Summary: This collaboration merges Actress's avant-garde electronic production with Suzanne Ciani's pioneering modular synthesis expertise, creating a unique fusion of experimental and ambient electronic music.
Festival Bio (EN):
Five-time Grammy award-nominated composer Suzanne Ciani, an icon and early pioneer of electronic music composition, joins producer Darren J. Cunningham, aka Actress, to perform *Concrète Waves* – the kind of collaboration that only floats to shore once in a lifetime. Ciani's first commercial album, *Seven Waves* (1982) wafted amidst the soothing and playful movements of seafoam – drawing on ocean metaphors to create a bubbling, synthesised body of work. With *Concrète Waves*, Actress and Ciani – with her signature Buchla synthesiser in tow – return to this concept.  

Cunningham's productions as Actress transport musique concrète into the twenty-first century, creating what he terms "R&B concrète" – where atmospheric scenes of twinkling ambience and furrowed noise meet sodium-lit field recordings and bassy warped drum sequences. In contrast to this practice – which is painted upon a backdrop of post-industrial urban life – Ciani evokes the natural world in her music.  

Although the duo offer a swell of contradictions, what they do share is a rare ability to build atmosphere and environment through electronics, texture, and timbre. It is in the overlapping middle-points between the natural and the metropolitan that their sound dwells – where roots entangle city infrastructure or, indeed, where the ocean waves crash up into modern life.  

Actress & Suzanne Ciani will perform an exclusive show at Amare during Rewire 2026.

Tagline: Experimental hip-hop duo blending dense lyricism, abstract production, and politically charged themes.
Bio: Armand Hammer is an experimental hip-hop duo from New York City, consisting of rappers billy woods and Elucid. Known for their dense lyricism, abstract production, and politically charged themes, they have garnered critical acclaim for albums like 'Paraffin' and 'Haram' (a collaboration with producer The Alchemist).
AI Summary: Armand Hammer's music combines intricate, thought-provoking lyricism with avant-garde production, often exploring themes of race, power, and societal critique. Their collaborations with prominent producers like The Alchemist have further solidified their reputation as one of the most innovative acts in underground hip-hop.
Festival Bio (EN): Armand Hammer is the New York City hip hop duo of rappers ELUCID and billy woods – whose performance at last year's festival was heralded as a highlight by many. For over a decade, Armand Hammer's undaunted lyricism and unparalleled flow has placed them uncontestedly at the forefront of underground hip hop. They just released *Mercy* (2025), where legendary hip hop producer The Alchemist meets the duo head on, paving soulful, sample-heavy cuts for the duo to tread on joyfully. Their sound pays homage to old school rap yet is truly of-the-moment, extrapolating east-coast hip hop flavours out towards infinity. The Alchemist's samples of jazz, prog rock, and soul make warm kindling for woods's and ELUCID's incendiary verses to burst into flame in listeners' ears. Featuring collaborators such as Earl Sweatshirt, Quelle Chris, and Cleo Reed, *Mercy* is a glorious collection of music that moves unpredictably – from slow and pensive to infectious and boisterous, Armand Hammer deliver their verses with the mastery and wisdom of two storied musicians at the top of their game.

Tagline: Innovative collaboration blending experimental electronic music with classical instrumentation.
Bio: Beatrice Dillon collaborates with the contemporary music group Explore Ensemble to create innovative works that blend experimental electronic music with classical instrumentation, pushing the boundaries of sound and structure.
AI Summary: Beatrice Dillon & Explore Ensemble merge avant-garde electronic textures with contemporary classical elements, resulting in a distinctive and cerebral sonic experience that challenges traditional genre boundaries.
Festival Bio (EN):
Artist and composer Beatrice Dillon has been involved in a string of genre-traversing and moment-defining releases in recent years, with her Workaround topping The Wire's album of the year list in 2020, and more recently with Basho (2025). While these play energetically with synthesis and complex rhythmic ideas, her 2024 album Seven Reorganisations, the inaugural release on Dillon’s own new label, HI, turns towards the patient, the minimal, and the purely acoustic – forming a resoundingly touching contemporary classical piece, performed by fellow London-based sextet Explore Ensemble. Their artful interpretations are at the forefront of Seven Reorganisations. Among piano inflections and minimal string lines, an ecosystem of organic, murmuring sounds comes alive. As if through magic, the performers dissolve into their instruments; the space around them is made to feel as if it's engulfed in anti-matter – and that all which exists is the animated instruments creating sounds in a lively macrocosm of vibration and timbre. 

In a world premiere performance, Beatrice Dillon and Explore Ensemble present Dillon’s major new composition, which incorporates Dillon’s digital synthesis with the Ensemble's acoustic instrumentation. This work is commissioned by Rewire, Barbican Centre, and Explore Ensemble, with support from the Ernst von Siemens Musikstiftung and PRS Foundation.

Tagline: Innovative UK techno producer blending raw, industrial sounds with experimental electronic music.
Bio: Blawan is a UK-based electronic music producer and DJ known for his innovative approach to techno and experimental electronic music. He gained prominence with his raw, industrial sound and has released critically acclaimed tracks on labels like Hessle Audio, R&S Records, and his own imprint, Ternesc.
AI Summary: Blawan's music is characterized by its gritty, industrial textures and innovative approach to techno, blending heavy percussion and experimental sound design. His work has been praised for pushing the boundaries of electronic music, making him a standout figure in the genre.
Festival Bio (EN):
Blawan's new album *Sick Elixir* (2025) should come with a corrosive materials warning; but like with all mysterious elixirs, doesn't half the fun come from the risk of consuming it? An alias of producer Jamie Roberts, Blawan has been a mainstay of the club scene for the last fifteen years. From his defining and way-paving early releases on Hinge Finger and Hessle Audio, to his prolific releases on his own imprint Ternesc, the producer is now signed with XL Recordings – who put out *Sick Elixir*. 

On this latest full-length, rough saw-tooth waves and grimey EBM synth lines are perforated by grizzly vocal samples spitting syllabic chants. His inventive percussive sampling and programming bring a chunky chopped-and-screwed sound to the dancefloor. Basked in a distinctly UK-inspired griminess, Blawan's not-quite-techno transmissions sound like lost signals from beyond this galaxy – arriving to our speaker cones as fuzzed-out club music full of clamouring beats and distortion-drenched bass. *Sick Elixir* is one of the most potent statements in club music recently: catch it live at Rewire 2026.

Tagline: Minimalist modular synth composer
Bio: Caterina Barbieri is an Italian electronic music composer and performer known for her minimalist and hypnotic modular synthesizer compositions. Her work explores the psychoacoustic effects of repetition and pattern-based music, earning critical acclaim for albums like 'Ecstatic Computation' and 'Spirit Exit.'
AI Summary: Caterina Barbieri's music is characterized by intricate modular synth patterns and a focus on minimalism, creating immersive and meditative soundscapes. Her innovative approach to electronic composition has positioned her as a leading figure in contemporary experimental music.
Festival Bio (EN):
Focusing around generative techniques and the creative potential of computation, Italian composer Caterina Barbieri has long channeled her curiosity into a cosmic mosaic of works touching on themes of memory, time, and perception. Through vivid modular synthesis and expanded electro-acoustic formats, she examines states of trance and altered consciousness. *Patterns of Consciousness* (2017) was Barbieri's breakthrough album, which introduced a larger audience to her alchemical approach to synthesis and composition. 

On her last album, *Myuthafoo* (2023), cavernous analogue synth soundscapes ring out with brilliant sustain that evaporates into the air. Before that, *Spirit Exit* (2022) offered an icy synth opus of compositions whose arpeggiated melodies were as complex as they were catchy. Barbieri's approach to music is surely theoretically grounded, yet her manifold compositions and works are also deeply intuitive. She treats her compositions as living organisms which are developed and altered through live performance; witness how they come to life at Rewire 2026's opening evening when Barbieri presents new music alongside guest musicians.

Tagline: A haunting fusion of minimal electronic soundscapes and experimental Arab folk, unearthing hidden histories.
Genre: ambient, techno, experimental Arab folk, minimal, electronic
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Translated as "civilian bastard," Civilistjävel! is a project from Swedish producer Tomas Bodén – whose ambient and techno experiments from the 90s onwards were kept as private recordings until the late 2010s, when he finally released them. Mayssa Jallad is a Lebanese architect and urban researcher who uses her music to unearth the hidden histories beneath Beirut's urban sprawl – singing to and for a population held hostage by its historical violence. Jallad's 2023 album Marjaa: The Battle of the Hotels explored an episode of urban warfare at the beginning of the Lebanese Civil War, wherein militias fought for domain across Beirut's skyscrapers. In 2025, Civilistjävel! reworked the album, transforming Jallad's experimental Arab folk sound world into a minimal, dubbed-out electronic snowscape – paving the way for Jallad's voice to rise like a monument amidst its subtle tones. In this world premiere performance, the icy tech-ambience of Civilistjävel!'s productions and the warm, gentle lustre of Jallad's voice come together as a curious contradiction of coexisting forces.
AI Summary: Civilistjävel! and Mayssa Jallad create a unique fusion of minimal electronic soundscapes and experimental Arab folk. Their collaboration reimagines Jallad's exploration of Beirut's historical violence with a stark, ambient aesthetic, allowing her evocative vocals to shine against a backdrop of icy, dub-infused textures. This partnership highlights a compelling juxtaposition of warmth and coldness, history and futurism.

Tagline: A haunting, avant-garde tribute to David Lynch's surreal masterpiece, blending experimental soundscapes with evocative visuals.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] At Rewire 2016, Angela Seo and Jamie Stewart, aka Xiu Xiu, presented what is now considered a cult classic performance: Xiu Xiu Plays The Music of Twin Peaks. 10 years on, Rewire proudly invites Xiu Xiu back into a Lynchian world of intrigue, darkness, and monstrous strangeness in the form of Eraserhead x Xiu Xiu. Somewhere between a living video installation and an intense homage to a lost idol, Eraserhead x Xiu Xiu delivers a singular tribute to David Lynch’s masterpiece debut film. Through field recordings, custom-built instruments, organ, modular synths, voice, flashlights, electrical interference, and musique concrète, Xiu Xiu offer a radical reinterpretation of Eraserhead's iconic soundtrack by composer Alan Splet, accompanied by evocative visuals. Xiu Xiu's music has long pulled at the loose tethers that bind the illusion of contemporary US life, deconstructing – in a similar way to how Lynch often did – the candy-flavoured veneer atop that vast place seeped in darkness. It's hard to imagine a more fitting crossover for the group than Eraserhead, Lynch's wondrous and absurdist critique of nuclear family-making and post-industrial alienation – with the emphasis on nuclear and alien.

The project is a fitting homage to Lynch's dark, absurdist critique of modern life, aligning with Xiu Xiu's signature style of deconstructing the illusions of contemporary US culture.

Tagline: An ethereal blend of lo-fi textures, minimalist percussion, and resonant vocal harmonies.
Genre: drone, ambient, electronics, improvisation, minimalist dance music
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Theodora Laird is the vocalist and multidisciplinary artist behind the project feeo. Goodness (2025), her debut album with label AD93, features wrinkled synth lines, bit-crushed into insectoid murmurs, and organ chords stretched out into infinity – suggesting an intimate yet haunting hymnal quality. This music carries past lives and ghostly histories; it arrives at the window like a familiar apparition, staying at arm's length before leaning in to share a whisper. Goodness is a trove of experiments in drone, ambient, electronics, improvisation, and minimalist dance music – all bound by themes of connection and isolation. Crackling tape hiss dissolves into brass swells and fragile piano melodies, cut through by Laird's gentle yet powerful voice – which carries the poetic lyricism and pristine tone of Broadcast's Trish Keenan but inflected with a hint of transcendent R&B flair. feeo revels in low-ends and sub-bass, extracting clubby frequencies and transporting them to her ethereal sound world of lo-fi textures, minimal percussion, and resonant vocal harmonies. For her live show, feeo will be joined by improviser and experimental musician Caius Williams on bass and guitar.

Tagline: Hypnotic harmonies and genre-blending sounds from Copenhagen's Fine Glindvad Jensen.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] From softly sung country ballads and jangling slacker rock to warm lo-fi folk and gleaming dream pop, Fine – the project of singer-songwriter and producer Fine Glindvad Jensen – offers a trove of hypnagogic harmonies. After a decade as vocalist for the group CHINAH, she began co-writing songs with Erika de Casier for K-pop stars NewJeans. Then, she stepped into the solo spotlight with her debut album *Rocky Top Ballads* (2024), which she fully wrote and produced. Fine's sound is chock-full of the hypnotic and charming warblephonics that characterise the larger Copenhagen scene coming out of Rytmisk Musikkonservatorium (Rhythmic Music Conservatory) – whose alumni include Astrid Sonne (with whom Glindvad has the project Coined), ML Buch, and de Casier. Her latest singles, sprinkled across 2025, form the groundwork for a forthcoming album where her sound evolves further, building upon the earworm melodies and the chiming guitar tones of *Rocky Top Ballads*.

Her debut album *Rocky Top Ballads* (2024) showcases her talent as both a songwriter and producer, with a sound that reflects the innovative Copenhagen music scene. Her recent singles hint at further evolution, building on the melodic and atmospheric qualities of her debut.

Tagline: Experimental guitarist blending American primitive style with ambient and avant-garde influences.
Bio: Hayden Pedigo is an experimental guitarist and composer from Amarillo, Texas, blending elements of American primitive guitar with ambient and avant-garde influences. He gained attention for his intricate fingerpicking style and unique approach to acoustic music, as well as for his satirical city council campaign in 2019.
AI Summary: Hayden Pedigo's music combines the intricate fingerpicking techniques of American primitive guitar with ambient textures, creating a meditative and evocative soundscape. His work has drawn comparisons to guitar legends like John Fahey, while his offbeat public persona adds an intriguing layer to his artistry.
Festival Bio (EN): Hayden Pedigo is a fresh link in the timeworn chain of post-blues instrumental solo fingerstyle guitarists. Homeschooled in "the middle of nowhere," as an artist, he seeks an authentic and genuine connection with his audience, welcoming them into the fractures in linear time that his pieces create. Pedigo says of his music that it's in the long pauses, silences, and breaks that he pays tribute to the flat plains of his Texan hometown, Amarillo. "There's a sadness in the sound of Amarillo," says Pedigo, but his music wafts between joy and sorrow, with him as wordless storyteller, appearing somewhere on the continuum near the sad clowns and the joyful funeral directors. *I'll Be Waving As You Drive Away* (2025) is the third record in his "Motor Trilogy" of records with label Mexican Summer – referred to as such due to their transient character and the vehicle motifs emblazoning their colourful, abstract covers. The colourful abstraction of Pedigo is not limited to his choice of album art; it seeps out into both his personality and the warm, blissful, strange music he creates. He performs twice at Rewire 2026, both solo, and with a string quartet.

Tagline: Ethereal ambient-folk visionary
Bio: Hilary Woods is an Irish musician and visual artist known for her ethereal and atmospheric blend of ambient and folk music. A former bassist for the band JJ72, she has since embarked on a solo career, releasing critically acclaimed albums such as 'Colt' and 'Birthmarks'.
AI Summary: Hilary Woods crafts hauntingly intimate soundscapes that merge ambient textures with delicate folk melodies. Her work is praised for its emotional depth, cinematic quality, and experimental approach to songwriting.
Festival Bio (EN): Following two enchanting instrumental records, *Feral Hymns* (2021) and *Acts of Light* (2023), on her latest release, *Night CRIÚ* (2025), Irish artist Hilary Woods returns to using her voice – parting the veil of mystery that ruminates in her compositions, placing herself into the fray of her experimental ambient slowcore production. *Night CRIÚ*’s sonic palette features floods of texture, brass, strings, drone, and field recordings, which converge around Woods's refined yet powerful vocals. Moving between lightness and darkness, between moments of ecstatic reveal and hushed sections of restraint, Woods's dusky songs linger in the heart as much as they do in the ear. She performs her acclaimed new album *Night CRIÚ* at Lutherse Kerk as part of Rewire 2026 – carrying her devotional songs to a venue with an intimate sense of scale fit for her vast yet close sound.

Tagline: Experimental musician blending electronic textures with avant-garde pop to explore identity and emotion.
Bio: James K is an experimental musician and producer blending electronic textures with avant-garde pop sensibilities. Her work often explores themes of identity and emotion through unconventional soundscapes.
AI Summary: James K crafts a unique fusion of experimental electronic music and avant-pop, characterized by her innovative production techniques and introspective themes. Her sound is both ethereal and boundary-pushing, earning her recognition in underground music circles.
Festival Bio (EN): Jamie Krasner is a key figure in New York's underground scene. A prolific collaborator with artists such as Oli XL, Yves Tumor, and Drew McDowall (Coil), her solo project, james K, is where she turns her gaze inwards to craft elastic and ethereal pop. Her third solo album, Friend (2025), released on AD93 to critical acclaim; it is a fruitful outcome to james K's serial experiments in dream pop and beyond. Krasner's downtempo music offers a sense of connection among the digital fray of contemporary times, but she circumnavigates the hyper-acceleration of the modern moment, offering instead her music at a glitchy and meditative 56k-modem pace. As a true friend often does, Krasner's Friend leads listeners into a personal and emotive space that is both welcoming and challenging. Its murmuring bit-crushed sounds border on lo-fi aesthetics, yet the james K sound could not be described as anything other than pristine. Her brand of soft shoegazy pop and undulating trip-hop sits gracefully atop a cushion of expansive ambience and broad bass.

Tagline: Exploring the intersections of sound, language, and identity through jazz, ambient music, and spoken word.
Bio: JJJJJerome Ellis is a composer, poet, and multi-instrumentalist whose work explores the intersections of sound, language, and identity, often incorporating elements of jazz, ambient music, and spoken word. His projects frequently address themes of time, disability, and Blackness, creating deeply personal and thought-provoking art.
AI Summary: JJJJJerome Ellis creates a unique fusion of experimental soundscapes, poetic spoken word, and jazz-inflected compositions. His work is celebrated for its innovative exploration of identity and time, offering a deeply introspective and boundary-pushing auditory experience.
Festival Bio (EN): JJJJJerome Ellis's debut album on NNA Tapes – The Clearing (2021), accompanied by a publication of the same name – was a moving and singular work touching on concepts of Blackness, stuttering, dysfluency, and ways of disrupting linear time. Anyone who was there to witness their performance at Rewire 2022 can attest to the intimate curiosity and generous sonic experimentations at the core of Ellis's practice. Ellis, as composer, producer, multi-instrumentalist, and writer, creates atmospheric soundscapes with saxophone, organ, hammered dulcimer, electronics, and their voice, as can also be heard on their stunning sophomore record Vesper Sparrow (2025). It is a continuation of their ongoing study into the intersections between music and sound, stuttering, and Blackness, through the lens of time. It is apt that at Rewire 2026, Ellis performs their experimental jazz, spoken word, and improvised musique concrète in the halls of Lutherse Kerk – a place where time has a way of standing still.

Tagline: Blending intricate guitar work with ambient, post-rock, and indigenous influences for an emotive and immersive sound.
Bio: Joshua Chuquimia Crampton is an experimental musician and composer known for his intricate guitar work and atmospheric soundscapes. His music blends elements of ambient, post-rock, and indigenous influences, creating a deeply emotive and immersive listening experience.
AI Summary: Joshua Chuquimia Crampton crafts evocative soundscapes that merge experimental guitar techniques with ambient and post-rock textures, often drawing on his indigenous heritage for a unique and introspective musical style.
Festival Bio (EN): Crashing waves of grunge maximalism and layers of distorted riffs coalesce in the power ambient summonings of Joshua Chuquimia Crampton. The California-based musician and artist, a member of the Great Pakajaqi Nation of Aymara People, has been steadily building a reputation as one of the most exciting experimental guitarists playing today. His debut, The Heart's Wash (2020), is a slow-burning chronicle of vast sounds – from subtle finger-picked lullabies to noise-drenched distortion – all cushioned by a comforting 60 cycle hum. The minimalist warble-phonics of sophomore record 4 (2021) led to the warm psychedelia of Profundo Amor (2023). Chuquimia Crampton's latest album, Estrella Por Estrella (2024), bubbles with the abyssal warmth and low-fidelity of a bedroom black metal that has been stripped of its blast beats – instead worming itself into the listener solely through the potentials of distorted thrumming strings. Chuquimia Crampton also performs at the festival alongside his sibling Chuquimamani-Condori, presenting the duo's much-lauded project Los Thuthanaka.

Tagline: A groundbreaking collaboration blending feminist avant-garde vocal experimentation with cutting-edge electronic soundscapes.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] In an inter-generational collaboration, poet, actress, visual artist, and performer Katalin Ladik performs with composer and experimental sound artist Svetlana Maraš. Ladik's journey into performance began at the end of the 1960s, where her work in poetry led her to work on Hungarian radio plays, which she did until the end of the 1970s. Searching for her own way of self-expression, she began experimental artistic practices and auto-referential performative explorations of the “gendered self” in Yugoslavia, Hungary, and abroad. A compilation of her work across the 70s titled *Phonopoetics* (2019) showcases her unbridled flair for vocal experimentation and creative phonetic fabulations. Ladik, a vanguard of the feminist avant-garde movements in the former Yugoslavia, will present a duo project with Maraš. The duo was formed during Ladik's residency at Radio Belgrade's Electronic Studio in 2019, where Maraš was artistic director. They composed tracks combining voice and the EMS Synthi 100 synthesiser, which were part of the release – *Water Angels* (2021).
AI Summary: Katalin Ladik & Svetlana Maraš combine avant-garde vocal experimentation with cutting-edge electronic soundscapes. Their work, rooted in feminist and experimental traditions, features a unique interplay of Ladik's vocal artistry and Maraš's expertise with the EMS Synthi 100 synthesizer. Their 2021 release *Water Angels* showcases their innovative approach to sound and performance.

Tagline: Indonesian duo KUNTARI channels primal-core energy with a fusion of ancient rhythms and experimental soundscapes.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Taking up the mantle of "primal-core" for their chosen genre descriptor, KUNTARI wield a vicious and energetic sound that appears to be extracted from the molten depths of the earth's core. The Indonesian duo of musicians Tesla Manaf and Rio Abror defected from jazz orthodoxy to pursue an otherworldly form of music-making, blending traditional sounds from their homeland with field-recorded soundscapes and pulsing somatic rhythms. They have never sounded better than on their new album MUTU BETON (2025) on label 99CHANTS. Mounting tension and intensity build and dissolve across its enchanting eight tracks, which roar with roto toms, resounding bells, thrumming percussive guitar, and dueling sarons – a single-octave metallophone. Borrowing from tribal Indonesian rhythms resurrected from the sixteenth century, there is a sense of ancient ceremony breathing through KUNTARI's songs. Yet their music sounds too like a presage of a post-collapse world where industrial sounds evaporate into a more urgent, humane timbre.
AI Summary: KUNTARI is an Indonesian duo that blends traditional Indonesian sounds, field-recorded soundscapes, and primal rhythms to create an experimental and visceral musical style they describe as 'primal-core.' Their music incorporates ancient ceremonial influences, such as sixteenth-century tribal rhythms, and combines them with modern, industrial, and percussive elements. Their 2025 album 'MUTU BETON' showcases their innovative approach, featuring unique instrumentation like dueling sarons and roto toms, creating a sound that is both ancient and futuristic.

They have never sounded better than on their new album MUTU BETON (2025) on label 99CHANTS. Mounting tension and intensity build and dissolve across its enchanting eight tracks, which roar with roto toms, resounding bells, thrumming percussive guitar, and dueling sarons – a single-octave metallophone. Borrowing from tribal Indonesian rhythms resurrected from the sixteenth century, there is a sense of ancient ceremony breathing through KUNTARI's songs. Yet their music sounds too like a presage of a post-collapse world where industrial sounds evaporate into a more urgent, humane timbre.

Tagline: A sibling duo creating a vibrant, bit-crushed collage of ancestral rhythms and experimental soundscapes.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] With Los Thuthanaka, two siblings – Chuquimamani-Condori, who performed at Rewire 2024, and Joshua Chuquimia Crampton, who performs at this year's edition – come together to take listeners into a parallel world of indescribable texture and rhythm. Like being dragged from the wrist by a giddy friend, Los Thuthanaka (2025), the duo's eponymous debut – one of the most impressive albums of the year – takes you into a crowd of sounds, where swirling snare drums, bombos, DJ tags, cheers, and whistles engulf you as the bass drums guide your feet forward. Referencing what they call ayni (or "reciprocity" in the Aymara language) to their community for giving them the gift of music, their huayño and caporal rhythms and melodies are emaciated by crusty noise and buried beneath layers and layers of all-consuming sound – creating a bit-crushed collage of hopeful mayhem and joy that draws on ancestral wisdom and traditional sounds while sounding completely new. Their utterly vibrant and undeniably colourful music sounds like plunderphonic experimentalism adapted for these hyper-active times, with a trigger-happy jester on sampler duties and a masterful prankster behind the percussion.

Tagline: Blending traditional Arabic influences with contemporary indie and alternative sounds, Mayssa Jallad captivates with her evocative voice and poignant lyrics.
Bio: Mayssa Jallad is a Lebanese singer-songwriter known for her evocative voice and poignant lyrics that blend traditional Arabic influences with contemporary indie and alternative sounds.
AI Summary: Mayssa Jallad's music combines heartfelt storytelling with a fusion of Arabic musical traditions and modern indie sensibilities, creating a distinctive and emotionally resonant sound.
Festival Bio (EN): Mayssa Jallad's background as an architect and urban researcher shines through in her music: it is intentional, critical, detailed, and thoughtful – drawing on the hidden histories and events buried under the concrete and bustle of Beirut's urban sprawl. She has a particular interest in sharing difficult collective histories with post-war youths who haven't had easy access to the stories of their city – hoping that these tales, told anew in generous musical form, might regenerate or spur on a sense of urgency and change for populations held hostage to their historical violence. Her experimental Arab folk sound features gentle nylon guitar, swells of synthesis, faint treated piano, and, stirring above it all, Jallad's moving vocals – imbued with the wisdom of a storyteller and the sensitivity of a loved one. Her forthcoming album is the follow-up to 2023's Marjaa: The Battle of the Hotels – she presents music from both at Rewire 2026 alongside her trio. It explored an episode of urban warfare at the beginning of the Lebanese Civil War wherein militias fought for domain across Beirut's skyscrapers. Jallad also performs at Rewire 2026 alongside Civilistjävel!.

Tagline: A groundbreaking collaboration blending avant-garde jazz and experimental hip-hop.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Rewire presents a rare performance from ØKSE & billy woods. ØKSE is an international group of avant-garde musicians gathered around a boiling pot of wild, jazzy sounds. They're made up of NYC-based drummer Savannah Harris, Danish saxophonist Mette Rasmussen, Haitian electronic musician Val Jeanty, and Swede Petter Eldh on bass, synths, and sampler. billy woods is a NYC rapper who performed at last year's Rewire and was heralded by many as a festival highlight. ØKSE's collaboration with woods emerged from a chance encounter in a quiet Swiss town in 2022, when saxophonist Mette Rasmussen and woods played the same tiny venue. This meeting led to their collaboration, "Amager," a jaunty, high-tempo, bebop-hop track where turntablist breaks meld into live drums while ferocious bass keeps pace and saxophone bellows. As well as this set with ØKSE, woods performs elsewhere at the festival as part of Armand Hammer, his rap duo with ELUCID.

Tagline: Blending turn-of-the-century ambient traditions with organic, electro-acoustic warmth and radiant visuals.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Tommy Paslaski (aka Concave Reflection), Ben Paulson (aka kindtree), and Akeem Asani (aka Millia) are Purelink. It can be heard in their productions how both trust and experimentation form a guiding principle for the trio. Bringing new meaning to the term "peer to peer" music, it's almost as if we, as listeners, are intruding on a special moment of three friends coming together to revel in their creativity and curiosity. Although indebted to a certain turn-of-the-century ambient tradition, the group's music is never dragged down by a rigid sense of "digital-ness"; instead, its blissful tones bring about a deep sense of the organic and the unpredictable. With an electro-acoustic warmth akin to World of Echo-era Arthur Russell, their songs elicit late nights and early dawns, with ears hugged by headphones as street lights spark into life or begin their sleep. Minimal yet bassy, glitchy yet clear, Purelink's blossoming ambient music bursts with bright texture. At Rewire, they are joined by multidisciplinary artist Mika Oki, who adds radiant scenography and kinetic visuals to the show, which glow as Purelink's music does.

Tagline: Experimental electronic duo from Norway
Bio: Smerz is a Norwegian electronic music duo consisting of Catharina Stoltenberg and Henriette Motzfeldt. Known for their experimental approach, they blend elements of pop, R&B, and club music with abstract soundscapes, creating a unique and genre-defying sound.
AI Summary: Smerz crafts a distinctive fusion of electronic, pop, and experimental sounds, often incorporating fragmented beats, ethereal vocals, and avant-garde production. Their innovative approach has earned them recognition in the underground electronic music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Smerz's special brand of off-centre electronic warble pop is carried into the world by the collaborators, songwriters, musicians, and producers Catharina Stoltenberg and Henriette Motzfeldt. The duo's melancholic (and non-bucolic) album Big city life (2025) gathers a vivid collection of minimal SoundFont rock and R&B. With ghostly charm, the album's songs weave a story of romance and recklessness in rain-drenched city streets where puddles glisten with neon and swim with half-smoked cigarettes. Smerz deftly use nostalgia to paint their songs with a wispy curiosity, but their music is anything but backward-looking: they transform familiar sounds into new forms, birthing yet-unheard kinds of poppy sensitivity and open-hearted experimentalism. Like dream sequences, their music lives in the half-light between reality and reverie. At Rewire 2026, Smerz perform their critically acclaimed music accompanied by a band.

Tagline: Mutant R&B duo blending booty bass, sardonic British playfulness, and eclectic influences.
Bio:
[using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Formed in 2024, Tracey is a London-based duo creating mutant R&B unlike anyone else. Imagine booty bass dance music lathered with a frothy layer of sardonic British playfulness; think Miami via Millwall. Their eponymous debut EP arrived as a surprise in the summer of 2025, like a lower-back tattoo after a night on the town. Although it's frontloaded with the undeniable banger "Sex Life (feat. Riko Dan)," later in the EP, Tracey reveal their careful, slow, and atmospheric side: from the downtempo brilliance of "When I Choose to Be Here with You," to the touching emo-infused R&B of closer "Take Care," Tracey are full of surprises. 

Followup *Sleazy* (2025) returns to the hyperactive dance arena, borrowing too from PC Music with its colourful acoustics and tight sample style (which, like "Sex Life," has a satisfying Benassi bounciness to its vocal chops). Raunchy yet thoughtful, bassy yet subtle, Tracey create an anomaly of sounds, likely informed by the eclectic influences they cite: among them, Kylie Minogue, Skream, and Crystal Castles.

Tagline: Indie rock pioneers with cult acclaim
Bio: The Wrens are an influential indie rock band from New Jersey, known for their emotionally resonant lyrics, intricate guitar work, and dynamic songwriting. Their 2003 album 'The Meadowlands' is widely regarded as a classic in the indie rock genre.
AI Summary: The Wrens are celebrated for their heartfelt and introspective indie rock, blending melodic complexity with raw emotional depth. Their critically acclaimed album 'The Meadowlands' cemented their reputation as a cornerstone of the indie music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Experimentalist traversers of noisy jazz sounds, WRENS is a quartet made up of musicians Ryan Easter (on trumpet, voice, and words); Jason Nazary (on drums and synths, and who previously played with Saint Abdullah); Elias Stemeseder (on synths and una corda piano); and Lester St. Louis (on cello and electronics, and who performed as part of Amirtha Kidambi's Elder Ones at Rewire 2024). The feverish sophomore album from the group, Half of What You See (2025), provides a vision of a noise-encrusted free jazz rich in diabolic rap sonics. Its spoken word verses and bassy electronic percussion take on mutant hip-hop sounds, while its trumpet and piano tug at traditional jazz lexicons, hoping to tear them apart and use them anew. Their dynamic and improvised approach – as accomplished individual musicians joining together to revel in experimentation – paves the way for an unpredictable outburst of cross-genre magic.

Tagline: A Peruvian artist blending playful electronics, left-field guitar, and haunting vocals to explore personal and political themes.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Alejandra Cárdenas's music bursts with curiosity. The Peruvian-born artist began her career in Lima's underground music scene in the 2000s, and her DIY origins are clear to hear in her music: her playful and off-kilter electronics and left-field guitar style are melodically intriguing and brim with the gaiety of someone who is familiar with skirting conventions. Her repertoire of prolific albums has been released under the moniker of Ale Hop by labels such as Nyege Nyege, Buh Records, Karlrecords, and Superpang. Her latest album, A Body Like a Home (2025), marks her first time releasing under her own birth name. It centres on Cárdenas’s own voice, which takes on the dual role of witness and confessor, speaking to political upheaval and change in her home country. From collage-like field recordings and spoken word to haunting violin (guest performed on the recording by Amor Muere's Gibrana Cervantes) and whirring electronics, Cárdenas's confessional songs are moving and personal while also feeling abstract and uncanny. Alejandra Cárdenas will be joined live by Gibrana Cervantes on violin and Ignacio Briceño on guitar.

Tagline: Innovative composer blending acoustic and electronic elements into immersive, multisensory experiences.
Bio: Ash Fure is an American composer and sound artist known for her innovative approach to contemporary classical music, blending acoustic and electronic elements to create immersive, multisensory experiences. Her works often explore the physicality of sound and have been performed by leading ensembles and at major festivals worldwide.
AI Summary: Ash Fure's compositions push the boundaries of contemporary classical music, integrating experimental soundscapes and tactile sonic experiences. Her work is celebrated for its innovative use of space, texture, and audience engagement, making her a standout figure in modern experimental music.
Festival Bio (EN): Ash Fure's somatic musical practice eschews conventional composition and notation in favour of sculpting and wielding sound in a visceral way. In *Hive Rise* (2020), Fure performed with a rig of speaker cones, manipulating them through kinetic movement. For *Animal* (2025), she returns to this subwoofer assemblage, playing the 12-inch speaker cones with a large sheet of polycarbonate – which acts as a reflective surface that filters sound and light simultaneously. Techno ambience, whirring textures, and rustling patterns build and recede in Fure's frenetic percussive performance. Cyclical rhythms swarm into the listener's ears, burrowing deeper into some subconscious realm, pulsing with an omniscient strangeness. Fure’s unique live approach harnesses wild energy and sweaty athleticism – pouring every bit of herself into the performance. Making “a Feminist push against some of the more disembodied approaches to electronic music,” her frequencies are created to be felt as much as heard: thick, hair-raising sub-bass washes over the audience, enveloping them into a noisy ocean of sound – part club, part avant-garde, and all the way animalistic.

Tagline: Trailblazing artist of transcendent soundscapes
Bio: Beverly Glenn-Copeland is a Canadian musician and composer known for blending folk, electronic, and jazz elements into deeply emotive and spiritual music. His 1986 album 'Keyboard Fantasies' gained renewed acclaim decades later, establishing him as a pioneer of experimental and ambient music.
AI Summary: Beverly Glenn-Copeland's innovative fusion of folk, electronic, and jazz creates a timeless and meditative sound. His work, particularly the rediscovered 'Keyboard Fantasies,' has been celebrated for its forward-thinking production and emotional depth, influencing a new generation of artists.
Festival Bio (EN): Beverly-Glenn Copeland is a person whose music and character has touched and inspired musicians and people across many generations. His foundational album *Keyboard Fantasies* (1986) – written and performed on with a Yamaha DX7, a Roland TR-707, and with Copeland's unique voice – is now considered a groundbreaking release, far ahead of its time. It combined new-age minimalism, early Detroit techno rhythms, and the humble warmth of traditional songwriting into a blooming nursery of new sounds that still sounds fresh, 40 years on. Originally released in a small cassette run, it was considered a near-lost overlooked classic until it found its way into the spotlight through word of mouth, before being reissued in the late 2010s – leading to a re-flourishing of Copeland's musical career, which included reissues of his earlier work, like his debut self-titled album (1970), but also the development of new music which develops further his sound: gentle folk-jazz explorations, compelling gospel harmonies, and West African drumming, all accompanied by his singular voice. His new album *Laughter in Summer* will be released in February 2026, the follow-up to the much adored *The Ones Ahead* (2023). Copeland is joined at Rewire 2026 by his wife and collaborator, Elizabeth Copeland – she is a theatre artist, writer, producer, and arts educator whose work over the past forty-plus years traverses arts and activism.

Tagline: Innovative UK-based duo blending electronic music, vocal improvisation, and conceptual art.
Bio: Cara Tolmie and Rian Treanor are UK-based experimental artists who collaborate to create immersive performances blending electronic music, vocal improvisation, and conceptual art. Their work often explores the intersection of sound, movement, and space, pushing the boundaries of traditional music performance.
AI Summary: Cara Tolmie and Rian Treanor craft avant-garde performances that merge abstract electronic soundscapes with vocal experimentation and conceptual art, creating a distinctive and boundary-pushing auditory experience.
Festival Bio (EN): From a series of charged improvisational performances, the duo of Cara Tolmie and Rian Treanor developed their exciting debut album, *Body Lapse* (2025), on label Planet Mu, harnesses the kinetic energy of their live performances into a document of pounding rhythms and vocal intensity. On one side of the collaboration, Treanor's crisp, bassy, and often minimal productions form the bedrock upon which Tolmie, on the other side, builds pillars of sound with her incredible voice – moving between poetic spoken word and bristling exasperated singing, at times recalling the trembling vocal outbursts of early Björk. She speaks and sings stream-of-consciousness incantations through her somatic and self-developed internal singing technique. Treanor plays with her voice, chopping up samples, creating a mimicking effect that weaves magically into the duo's disorienting and surreal music. Flirting with PC music aesthetics and hyper-pop frequencies, the music is at times squeaky and staccato, but there is always a rave-inspired barrage of bass waiting around the corner. Between Treanor's bassy interventions and Tolmie's erupting vocals, there is a sense of push and pull, encapsulated perfectly by the duo's ecstatic and bodily live performances.

Tagline: Exploring the hypnotic fusion of modular synthesis and orchestral experimentation.
Bio: Caterina Barbieri is an Italian composer and electronic musician known for her minimalist and modular synthesizer compositions. Her collaboration with ONCEIM (Orchestre de Nouvelles Créations, Expérimentations et Improvisation Musicales) explores the intersection of electronic and orchestral music, creating immersive and hypnotic soundscapes.
AI Summary: Caterina Barbieri's work with ONCEIM blends her signature minimalist electronic style with the rich textures of orchestral instrumentation, resulting in a deeply atmospheric and experimental sound. Her innovative approach to modular synthesis and collaboration with avant-garde ensembles has garnered critical acclaim.
Festival Bio (EN): On Rewire 2026's opening evening at Amare, Italian composer and artist Caterina Barbieri will present a new collaboration with ONCEIM – the Orchestra of New Musical Creation, Experimentation, and Improvisation. Barbieri has written a new composition for the orchestra and will perform it with them. Barbieri has long channeled her curiosity into a cosmic mosaic of electronic works touching on themes of memory, time, and perception. Focussing around generative techniques and the creative potential of computation, and using vivid modular synthesis and expanded electro-acoustic formats, Barbieri examines states of trance and altered consciousness. Her approach to music is surely theoretically grounded, yet her manifold compositions and works are also deeply intuitive. She treats her compositions as living organisms which are developed and altered through live performance. Led by artistic and musical director Frédéric Blondy, ONCEIM is an orchestra of over thirty musicians from a variety of musical backgrounds, including improvised music, jazz, classical and contemporary music, and experimental music.

Tagline: Pioneers of industrial avant-garde music
Bio: Einstürzende Neubauten is a German band formed in 1980, known for their innovative use of unconventional instruments and industrial sounds to create experimental music. They are considered pioneers of the industrial music genre and have influenced countless artists with their avant-garde approach.
AI Summary: Einstürzende Neubauten's groundbreaking use of found objects and industrial noise, combined with poetic lyrics and experimental structures, has cemented their status as one of the most innovative and influential acts in the industrial and experimental music scenes.
Festival Bio (EN): Emerging from the uncanny strangeness of 1980s West Berlin, Einstürzende Neubauten, infamous and legendary arbiters of chaos, scrappily used what was available to them to create their industrialised art rock. Lead by Blixa Bargeld – alongside N.U. Unruh, Jochen Arbeit, and Rudolph Moser – a throughline across Einstürzende Neubauten's decades-spanning career is the use of self-made instruments constructed from steel sheets, construction detritus, and found materials (they famously attempted to drill through the ICA's floor to access the hidden tunnels beneath). 45 years after its release, their debut studio album *Kollaps* (1981) still carries a vivid and new-feeling sensibility. Grinding machinic sounds and industrial percussive battery folds into punk diatribes, eerie ambient noise, and long ritualistic refrains. Their sound has collapsed and been rebuilt into new forms continuously: from the erratic frayed edges of their early industrial material to their more intentional material of the 00s and beyond, Einstürzende Neubauten's current iteration – exclusive to the Netherlands at Rewire – creates a kosmische kind of music that they refer to as "alien pop music" – such as with *Alles In Allem* (2020) and *Rampen* (2024).

Tagline: Innovative electronic artist crafting experimental soundscapes with ambient textures.
Bio: ex_libris is a solo electronic artist from the Netherlands, known for creating intricate and experimental soundscapes that blend ambient textures with innovative electronic production.
Festival Bio (NL): ex_libris is the latest project from former The Hague local Dave Huismans, whose releases as 2562 and A Made Up Sound on labels such as Tectonic, Delsin, and The Trilogy Tapes were mainstays of the then-burgeoning dubstep-techno crossover and experimental dance music landscapes. He returned in 2025 with two 12-inch records of deep, textural leftfield house. Across the tracks released so far, the ex_libris sound fizzes with gritty textures, leaning into ambient territory with its pads and tones, yet it is also undeniably club-ready, with low, heavy frequencies that pack a punch. The constantly evolving tracks are propelled forward by thumping bassdrums, tumbling drum samples, and dynamic rhythms that act as throughlines for an uncontrollable overgrowth of organic and acoustic samples, bristling and gnarling with energy and movement. At Rewire 2026, Huismans presents the world premiere live performance of his ex_libris project as a special A/V show in collaboration with graphic and motion designer Bernie van Vlijmen. This live set will feature plenty of new music to be released across 2026.

Tagline: London-based trio blending macro-minimal spiritual jazz with experimental and contemporary sounds.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] London-based experimental jazz trio Flur was formed by harpist Miriam Adefris, percussionist Dillon Harrison, and Isaac Robertson on saxophone and synthesiser. Their debut album, *Plunge* (2025), released in September with Parisian label Latency – who have released Rewire alumni such as TLF Trio, goat (jp), and Valentina Magaletti. On *Plunge*, Flur delivers a generous glimpse into their world of macro-minimal spiritual jazz, which pays homage to the artists who crystallised this sound – such as Alice Coltrane – while sounding thoroughly contemporary through its bright production and experimental, exploratory approach. Warm thrumming swells of brass, encircling harp arpeggios, and scattered textural drums build Flur's sound. At moments, there is a curious synthesised ambience carpeting Adefris's wandering harp and Harrison's tight drumming that touches on lo-fi motifs – with the song "Hold Fast Old Kelp" in particular pulsing with a hip-hop beat under its elemental melodies. Their debut reaches its climactic end with the cinematic and slow-moving "The Lighthouse," which beams Flur's harmonious echoes out like a beacon.

Bio: Ganavya is a vocalist and composer whose work blends jazz, Indian classical music, and folk traditions. She is known for her innovative interpretations and collaborations across diverse musical genres.

Festival Bio (EN): Ganavya is a vocalist and composer whose transcendent and fluent music brings the Hindu storytelling tradition of harikatha into the twenty-first century. 2024's Daughter of a Temple, released on Leiter, offered a deeply moving blend of spiritual jazz and South Asian devotional music. It was quickly followed up by 2025's Nilam, where, again, Ganavya's sincere vocals lead listeners into a warm world of song where jazz, traditional, and folk instruments concatenate and murmur together softly. Her words, sung with incredible mastery, are so subtle and sensitive yet so clearly powerful and complex. Her music is controlled and wistful, never veering off the rails or fraying too far from its path – yet the path it walks is entirely its own. Inspired by what she terms the "musico-philosophies" of Alice Coltrane, Ganavya's fusion music is spiritual and contemplative, offering listeners a slow, meditative experience much needed in these times of utter acceleration.

Tagline: Intricate fingerstyle guitar meets ambient folk, inspired by American Primitive traditions.
Bio: Hayden Pedigo is a Texas-based musician and composer known for his intricate fingerstyle guitar playing and ambient folk compositions, drawing inspiration from American Primitive guitarists like John Fahey.
AI Summary: Hayden Pedigo blends the intricate techniques of American Primitive guitar with ambient textures, creating a meditative and evocative soundscape that bridges traditional folk and experimental music.
Festival Bio (EN): Hayden Pedigo is a fresh link in the timeworn chain of post-blues instrumental solo fingerstyle guitarists. Homeschooled in "the middle of nowhere," as an artist, he seeks an authentic and genuine connection with his audience, welcoming them into the fractures in linear time that his pieces create. Pedigo says of his music that it's in the long pauses, silences, and breaks that he pays tribute to the flat plains of his Texan hometown, Amarillo. "There's a sadness in the sound of Amarillo," says Pedigo, but his music wafts between joy and sorrow, with him as wordless storyteller, appearing somewhere on the continuum near the sad clowns and the joyful funeral directors. *I'll Be Waving As You Drive Away* (2025) is the third record in his "Motor Trilogy" of records with label Mexican Summer – referred to as such due to their transient character and the vehicle motifs emblazoning their colourful, abstract covers. The colourful abstraction of Pedigo is not limited to his choice of album art; it seeps out into both his personality and the warm, blissful, strange music he creates. He performs twice at Rewire 2026, both solo, and with a string quartet.

Tagline: Innovative duo blending jazz, electronic, and ambient music with intricate textures and atmosphere.
Bio: Jim O’Rourke and Eiko Ishibashi are a collaborative duo known for their experimental and avant-garde music, blending elements of jazz, electronic, and ambient styles. Their work often features intricate arrangements and a focus on texture and atmosphere, showcasing their individual talents and shared artistic vision.
AI Summary: The duo's music is a compelling fusion of experimental soundscapes, drawing from jazz, electronic, and ambient influences. Their collaborative projects highlight a deep commitment to sonic exploration and innovative composition, making them a standout in the avant-garde music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Jim O’Rourke and Eiko Ishibashi are two experimental artists that need little introduction. Ishibashi, who performed a spellbinding set at last year's festival, is a renowned artist and composer whose latest album *Antigone* (2025) followed beloved soundtracks to Oscar-winning film *Drive My Car* (2021) and *Evil Does Not Exist* (2023). O'Rourke is a stalwart of Chicago's improv scene, a prolific composer for film, and a former member of Gastr del Sol and Sonic Youth. *Pareidolia* (2025) is their fifth release as a duo; this gorgeous album of deconstructed orchestral sounds, glitchy electronics, and warm fuzz serves as a montage of improvisations and performances captured live. The sounds wander freely yet remain rooted in some kind of effervescent intention – like two bonfire sparks dancing in the wind, or two fireflies led by each other's flickering brightness. In Ishibashi and O’Rourke's music one can hear a deep sense of conversation, interplay, and, arguably, affection. Meditative yet never sleepy, comforting yet never predictable, *Pareidolia* stands as a wonderful document of what the duo are capable of creating when their sparkling electronics, atmospheric strings, glimmering textures, and fortuitous flutes combine.

Tagline: A painter and musician blending folky guitar and voice with emotive, lullabic qualities and warm reverberations.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Painter and musician Joanne Robertson creates reverberating worlds of rippling halcyon sounds. Her output often stems from collaborations between friends – most recently with Elias Rønnenfelt on Heavy Glory (2024), Sidsel Meineche Hansen on Alien Baby (2021), and with her long-time collaborator Dean Blunt on Backstage Raver (2024). For Blurrr (2025), her critically acclaimed latest album on AD 93, Robertson collaborated with cellist, composer, and producer Oliver Coates, who joins her for a special performance at Rewire 2026 in the blissful Lutherse Kerk to perform the album's songs. Blurrr was written between painting sessions and while raising a child, which can be heard in the emotive, serene, and lullabic quality of the album. Basked in warm reverberations, Robertson's music for guitar and voice is at once folky and honest while holding depth and complication beyond its surface. Like an abstract painting, its seeming simplicity holds many secrets that only unfold with careful attention and willingness to enter its intuitive world head-on.

Tagline: Innovative pioneer of experimental folk
Bio: Juana Molina is an Argentine singer-songwriter and producer known for her unique blend of folk, electronic, and experimental music. Her critically acclaimed albums, such as 'Wed 21' and 'Halo,' showcase her innovative use of looping, layered vocals, and intricate soundscapes.
AI Summary: Juana Molina's music is a captivating fusion of traditional folk elements and experimental electronic textures, characterized by her use of looping and ethereal vocals. Her work has been praised for its originality and boundary-pushing approach, making her a standout figure in modern experimental music.
Festival Bio (EN): A fluffy white dog with a human head sits obediently, spotlit against a mysterious dark backdrop of silhouetted trees: this is the cover image for actress, composer, songwriter, producer, and cult performer Juana Molina's DOGA (2025) – the eighth full-length of her prolific career and her first album of new compositions in eight years, following Halo (2017). This artwork, which depicts a dog with Molina's face, hints at some of the mercurial elements swirling in her practice: aesthetically unique, tongue-in-cheek, and uncannily strange yet warmly familiar. Her music springs forth with sonic curiosities that sound at the same time like esoteric J-pop of the 1990s, South American folk music of the 1970s, and alien pop music from the 2080s. At this sprightly meeting point between past and future, Molina's music flourishes into being as something truly new – one-of-a-kind art pop driven by rhythmic synths and infectious, glitched-out guitars. The lo-fidelity spirit of her music is offset by the pristine clarity of her voice, which reigns above the intricate instrumentation of her otherworldly songs.

Tagline: A Glasgow-based DJ and producer reshaping club music with a thrilling blend of horror-infused darkness and high-energy experimental beats.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] KAVARI is a Glasgow-based DJ and producer whose thrilling contradiction of unconventional club sounds has cemented her as a key figure in the UK underground. On one end of the spectrum, there is the horror-infused darkness of a release like Rumination at the Abattoir (2025), where haunting field recordings and abstract, harsh electronics enmesh; on the other end, with releases like Suture (2022) and her Lost Cuts edit series, chopped and screwed jungle beats and ethereal pads billow while high energy percussion pumps beneath nightcore vocals and fragmented breaks. The kind of industrial beats that KAVARI produces are not deconstructed per se, but rather reassembled like a Frankenstein's monster of different parts that should not yet do fit together, creating new monstrous life. With influences as wide as Genesis P-Orridge and Skrillex, the range of sounds heard across her music starts to make sense. Hers is not humourless experimental club music; it holds an exaggerated vitality that borders on camp; it spills out of its borders and hopes you might slip on the residue it leaves in its wake. She presents a live A/V show at Rewire 2026.

Tagline: Experimental hip hop duo blending pitch-shifted vocals, Madlib-esque beats, and esoteric humor.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Multi-instrumentalist and vocalist Goya van der Heijden – of Devon Rexi – and DJ and producer Tobias Jansen – aka TBZ – are La Rat: an experimental hip hop duo whose eponymous LP on South of North sprung up out of the gutter in 2025. With pitch-shifted vocals accompanied by Madlib-esque beats, they take well-loved hip hop sounds and drench them in the murky strange canals of Danksterdam. The duo cite influences as far apart as bizarro turntablist noise-makers MC Hellshit & DJ Carhouse are to deep-listening composer Pauline Oliveros. This mashing of high and low art carries into their ethos; they've created something special and sonically intricate which manages to not take itself too seriously. There's humour leaking out of every corner of La Rat (2025), leaving a trail back to the nest they scurried out of. La Rat aren't only rodent scavengers of soulful crunchy samples but of chunky lyrics too, whose dribbling verses are assembled artfully into an esoteric trash-tableaux.

Tagline: Ethereal soundscapes blending ambient pop, neoclassical, and drone music.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Malibu is a French composer and vocalist whose otherworldly music spans drone, neoclassical, dance, and pop. Her euphorically meditative music muses on cities, seas, and the self, pillowing these themes in pianos and woodwinds, strings and pads. While some sing of what washes into the shore of contemporary life, Malibu's music is of the cusping waves over its horizon and of what soaking truths swim beneath them, out of grasp yet slowly careening into view, carried by water. With deep ambient production and fractured piano melodies that recall The Fragile-era Trent Reznor, and vocal calls that summon the eternal lilt of Enya's voice, Malibu's choral arrangements shimmer at the surface of an ocean of ambient pop – plunge into her unique sonic lexicon at Rewire 2026.

Tagline: Hauntingly experimental folkloric trip-hop with a modern twist on ancient traditions.
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Part slacker-trad and part crust-academic, Milkweed's explorations in folk, ritual, and tradition echo with haunting resonances. Distortion and lo-fi production act as a ghostly mask for what are, in many ways, quite joyful reinterpretations of British folk sounds. Their folkloric trip-hop takes existing historical and cultural source material – such as a mid-twentieth-century folklore journal, a book on Welsh myths, and another on Bronze-Age human remains – and drags it into the modern era. Their latest release, Remscéla (2025), is a partial reimagining of Irish poet Thomas Kinsella's canonical translation of the Irish pagan epic, Táin Bó Cúailnge – the tale of an invader queen who seeks to plunder a magical bull from her former husband. In the same way that these remscéla act as a preface in Kinsella's translation, Milkweed's album of the same title is a beautiful, curious introduction to what one can expect at one of their live shows: two mysterious people heartedly keeping oral storytelling traditions alive through wispy song and mischievous experimentation.

Tagline: Experimental electronic music innovator
Bio: Oneohtrix Point Never, the project of Daniel Lopatin, is known for its groundbreaking work in experimental electronic music, blending ambient, noise, and avant-garde elements. He has gained critical acclaim for albums like 'Replica' and 'Garden of Delete' and has composed scores for films such as 'Uncut Gems'.
AI Summary: Oneohtrix Point Never creates a unique soundscape that merges ambient textures, glitchy electronics, and avant-garde experimentation. His innovative approach to sound design and his work in film scoring have solidified his reputation as a leading figure in contemporary electronic music.
Festival Bio (EN): At a stage of his career where many others might settle into a predictable flow, Daniel Lopatin continues to burst the banks of expectation, flooding out and forming new tributaries of strange cybernetic sounds. November saw the release on the iconic Warp Records of his 11th studio album, the critically acclaimed Tranquilizer (2025) – a slightly misleading title, considering how revitalising and energetic it is. From soft synthesizer swells and ambient strings to sweltering percussive builds and bursts of clattering maximalism, Lopatin's music remains a contested site of both sensitive storytelling and chaotic playfulness. A true artisan of worldbuilding through sound and of playing with overlooked and forgotten sonic materials, for Tranquilizer, Lopatin quite literally assembled the music from the wreckage of commercial sample CDs, salvaged from the Internet Archive. As with much of his work, he draws humanity out from these otherwise innocuous sources of mellotron muzak, warbly melody, and chorus-drenched guitar. For Rewire’s 15th anniversary edition, Oneohtrix Point Never makes his return to the festival. Accompanied by celebrated visual artist Freeka Tet, OPN presents a live performance built around the new album. Any of those graced by the OPN performance at Rewire two years ago will know to expect the unexpected. Catch this Netherlands-exclusive performance at Rewire in Amare's grandiose Concertzaal.

Tagline: Experimental flamenco innovators
Bio: Raül Refree & Niño de Elche are a Spanish duo known for their experimental approach to flamenco, blending traditional elements with avant-garde and electronic influences. Their collaboration has been praised for pushing the boundaries of flamenco music and creating a unique, genre-defying sound.
AI Summary: The duo's innovative fusion of traditional flamenco with experimental and electronic elements has garnered critical acclaim, showcasing their ability to reimagine a historic genre with modern sensibilities.
Festival Bio (EN): In a Dutch premiere, composer, musician, and producer Raül Refree and key contemporary flamenco figure Niño de Elche perform their dreamlike electronic reimagining of flamenco and beyond. Following five years of touring together, the cult duo released their first collaborative album together in late 2025.Cru+esbrings together the mutant flamenco-infused electronica of Refree – who has produced for and collaborated with artists such as Rosalía and Sílvia Pérez Cruz – with the booming yet sensitive vocals of Niño de Elche – a stalwart of and beloved figure in Spanish avant-garde music. In a collision of tradition and futurity, the duo envision a new kind of flamenco sound where stirring, emotive vocals and palm-muted nylon strings get cozy next to galactic synthesis, heartworn ambience, and big, bassy production. What emerges from this unlikely yet somehow perfect collision of sounds is a distorted and ethereal kind of post-pop that bears little resemblance to other contemporary song-making approaches.

Tagline: A groundbreaking collaboration merging experimental metal with politically charged spoken word and noise.
Bio: Sumac & Moor Mother is a collaboration between the experimental metal band Sumac and the avant-garde poet and musician Moor Mother, blending heavy, improvisational soundscapes with politically charged spoken word and noise elements.
AI Summary: This collaboration merges Sumac's crushing, improvisational metal with Moor Mother's incisive, politically driven spoken word and experimental noise, creating a visceral and boundary-pushing sound that challenges conventional genre definitions.
Festival Bio (EN): Ten years after the release of their debut *The Deal* (2015), and one year after their critically acclaimed album *The Healer* (2024), Sumac – a band who infect metal music with a free jazz player's unpredictability and a noise musician's penchant for chaos and texture – joined forces with a cultural icon: Moor Mother – poet and sound artist Camae Ayewa, who is coming off the back of the critically acclaimed album *The Great Bailout* (2024). The outcome of this special, once-in-a-blue-moon kind of collaboration was *The Film* (2025), an uncompromising work of sludgy metal, experimental guitar music, and cutting-edge spoken word. While amplifier hums, scattered frequencies, and barrages of power chords and drums form the spine of *The Film*, it's Moor Mother's verses that pump its heart: speaking her close-held truths, she shares them abundantly with a cutting clarity that strikes through the cacophonous sludge battery of Sumac. Swirling convection currents of snarling riffs flow in and around Moor Mother's poetic and punchy commentary, which not just speaks but howls truth to power.

Tagline: Pioneers of post-rock experimentation
Bio: Tortoise is a Chicago-based instrumental band known for their innovative blend of post-rock, jazz, dub, and electronic music. Formed in the early 1990s, they are widely regarded as one of the most influential bands in the post-rock genre, with albums like 'Millions Now Living Will Never Die' and 'TNT' receiving critical acclaim.
AI Summary: Tortoise's genre-defying sound combines intricate rhythms, jazz-inspired improvisation, and ambient textures, making them a cornerstone of the post-rock movement. Their ability to seamlessly blend diverse musical styles has earned them a reputation as trailblazers in experimental music.
Festival Bio (EN): Tortoise – Dan Bitney, John Herndon, Douglas McCombs, John McEntire, and Jeff Parker – make their Rewire debut with an exclusive live show in the Netherlands. The band rose to prominence in the mid-90s by taking the familiar independent rock ingredients of the era and tossing them into a frothy kraut-jazz cauldron: from this effervescent mirth, their iconic, creative, rhythmic sound bubbled up into existence. Tortoise offered a different kind of band sound: urgent, strange, unpredictable, and, above all, new. From being early pioneers of experimental rock on their first two albums, the introduction of guitarist Parker to the group before their lauded third album TNT (1999) brought a cosmic free-jazz spirit to the group that has remained a staple quality of their sound since. The other elements that make up Tortoise span ambient, kraut rock, noise, electronics, and indie rock – each taking different space in their decades-spanning releases. Almost 10 years since the 8-bit odyssey of 2016's The Catastrophist, Tortoise returned in 2025 with a new single "Oganesson." This sleek, jazz-inflected song teases what can be expected on their forthcoming album Touch on beloved label International Anthem and Nonesuch Records.
